result.execSummary:
The defendant Henry Lee Watson Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation on 14CF3621, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

Consecutive to:  Consecutive to case 14CF3621 and consecutive to all other sentences, with credit for 90 DAYS time served, with Huber (including work, treatment and other Huber opportunities as afford by HOC), NO GOOD TIME (defendant not eligible). Court ordered absolute sobriety, and no contact with the victim of this case, any violation of this order would result in the loss of Huber, and balance of time would be served as straight time. 
Provide DNA Sample, unless already provided.
*6/1/2015  maybe  released  for electronic monitoring for healthcare.

Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Henry Lee Watson Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JOC & assessment electronically transmitted to DOC this date.
Letter to defendant explaining why HOC will not release him for medical issues.
Letter from defendant indicating that HOC will not release him for medical issues.
SIgned, Filed & Distributed, Order: The defendant's request for release privileges is granted. Defendant may be released for the following: Electronic Monitoring for Healthcare.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Lindsey Grady, Br. 23, for review. crt
Defendant's pro se request for electronic monitoring.
CORRECTION: Sentencing entry of 4/16/2015 reflects corrected case number of 14CF3621.

Defendant Henry Lee Watson in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Henry Lee Watson in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to case 14CF3621 and consecutive to all other sentences, with credit for 90 DAYS time served, with Huber (including work, treatment and other Huber opportunities as afford by HOC), NO GOOD TIME (defendant not eligible). Court ordered absolute sobriety, and no contact with the victim of this case, any violation of this order would result in the loss of Huber, and balance of time would be served as straight time. Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation on 14CF3621, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Provide DNA Sample, unless already provided. Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. 

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. Court VACATED the Jury Trial date of 5/4/2015.  Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant Henry Lee Watson in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Henry Lee Watson in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Final Pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution of this matter.
AS TO COUNT 1
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Bail Jumping (Felony), Domestic Abuse Assessments contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.49(1)(b), 973.055(1) a Class H Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
MOTION IN LIMINE.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Henry Lee Watson not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced. State requests joinder of cases 14CF3621 and 15CF306, court GRANTED, defense has 10 DAYS to file objection. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Henry Lee Watson in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Henry Lee Watson in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BETTY C.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Henry Lee Watson in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Henry Lee Watson in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch 23.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Henry Lee Watson Jr
Current: 2823 N 34TH ST, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 01-17-2015)
Prior: 1909 West Clark Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
